intro: Haplolobus sepikensis, commonly known as the Sepik lily, is a flowering plant native to the lowland rainforests of Papua New Guinea. It belongs to the family Alstroemeriaceae and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to deep pink. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are broad and lance-shaped, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Haplolobus sepikensis is valued for its ornamental beauty and plays a role in the local biodiversity of its native habitat.
